Package camzup.core

Class ColorKey

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.ColorKey
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<ColorKey>
public class ColorKey extends Object implements Comparable<ColorKey>
Stores a color at a given step (or percent) in the range [0.0, 1.0] . Equality and hash are based solely on the step, not on the color it holds.

  • Field Details

    • clr

      public final Color clr
      The key's color. Abbreviated to 'clr' because 'color' is a data type in Processing IDE.

    • step

      public float step
      The key's step, expected to be in the range [0.0, 1.0] .

  • Constructor Details

    • ColorKey

      public ColorKey()
      The default constructor. Creates a clear black color at 0.0 .

    • ColorKey

      public ColorKey(ColorKey source)
      Creates a key from a source.
      Parameters:
      source - the source key

    • ColorKey

      public ColorKey(float step)
      Creates a key at a given step. All values of the color (including alpha) are set to the step. To prevent confusion between step and color channels, a color key cannot be set with a single step, only constructed.
      Parameters:
      step - the step

    • ColorKey

      public ColorKey(float step, Color color)
      Creates a new key with a step and color.
      Parameters:
      step - the step
      color - the color

    • ColorKey

      public ColorKey(float step, int color)
      Creates a new key with a step and a color in hexadecimal.
      Parameters:
      step - the step
      color - the color

  • Method Details

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(ColorKey key)
      Returns -1 when this key is less than the comparisand; 1 when it is greater than; 0 when the two are 'equal'. The implementation of this method allows collections of keys to be sorted.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<ColorKey>
      Parameters:
      key - the comparisand
      Returns:
      the numeric code
